title: Data Analysis: NumPy + Pandas
story: Combine NumPy and Pandas for data analysis. This quest verifies both packages work together efficiently under the 2-second timeout.
instructions: Create a NumPy array [5, 10, 15, 20, 25], convert it to a Pandas Series, calculate the mean, and print it.
starterCode:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# Create array, convert to Series, calculate mean
data = np.array([5, 10, 15, 20, 25])
series = pd.Series(data)
mean_value = series.mean()
print(mean_value)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

data = np.array([5, 10, 15, 20, 25])
series = pd.Series(data)
mean_value = series.mean()
print(mean_value)

tests.expectedBehavior: Print the mean of the series

hints.text: Create the NumPy array first with np.array().
Convert to Pandas Series using pd.Series(data), then call .mean().
